Valentine's Day
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="valentinesday_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbac60ff3.-7510">Valentine's Day</h><pron-gs eid="valentinesday_prongs_1" psg="ald8_valentinesday_prongs_1" source="gl2018" wd="Valentine's Day"><pron-g-blk><brelabel><xhtml:a href="help:bre">BrE</xhtml:a></brelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ËˆvÃ¦lÉ™ntaÉªnz deÉª</phon>/</phon-blk><audio eid="valentinesday_audio_1" name="valentine_s_day#1_gb_1"></audio></xhtml:a></pron-g> <a href="snd://valentine_s_day_1_gb_1.spx"><audio-gb>ğŸ”Š</audio-gb></a></pron-g-blk><pron-g-blk><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><namelabel><xhtml:a href="help:name">NAmE</xhtml:a></namelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ËˆvÃ¦lÉ™ntaÉªnz deÉª</phon>/</phon-blk><audio eid="valentinesday_audio_2" name="valentine_s_day#1_us_1"></audio></xhtml:a></pron-g> <a href="snd://valentine_s_day_1_us_1.spx"><audio-us>ğŸ”Š</audio-us></a></pron-g-blk></pron-gs></top-g><sn-gs eid="valentinesday_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="valentinesday_sng_1"><cset cset="festcere" eid="valentinesday_cset_1"></cset><xr-gs firstinblock="n" xt="defat"><xrlabel> â€‚<arrow>â¡</arrow>â€‚ </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbac4af93.1414"><xh-blk><xh><a href="entry://entry://St Valentine's Day">St Valentine's Day</a></xh></xh-blk></xr-g></xr-g-blk> </xr-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>

<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="vane_hg_1"><top-g> <h variety is the spice of life

<xhtml:a href="x:movie">movie</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:production">production</xhtml:a>.  <xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>è¿™æ˜¯è¿™å®¶å…¬å¸é¦–æ¬¡æ¶‰è¶³ç”µå½±åˆ¶ä½œã€‚</chn></x><a href="snd://_venture__gbs_8.spx"><audio-gb-liju>ğŸ”Š</audio-gb-liju></a><xaudio eid="venture_xaudio_18" geo="n_am" </>

veracity

<hkey><xhtml:a href="help:keyword"><symbol type="key">ğŸ”‘</symbol></xhtml:a></hkey> <h e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5856">verÂ·sion</h><hawl> <xhtml:a href="help:awl"><boxtag type="awl">AW</boxtag></xhtml:a> <eb>Very</eb>  is not used with adjectives and adverbs that already have an extreme meaning. You are more likely to use an adverb such as <ei eid="very_ei_3" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-563d">absolutely</ei>, <ei eid="very_ei_4" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-563c">completely</ei>, etc.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>å«æç«¯æ„ä¹‰çš„å½¢å®¹è¯å’Œå‰¯è¯ä¸ç”¨ veryï¼Œè€Œå¸¸ç”¨ absolutelyã€completely ç­‰å‰¯è¯</chn>ï¼š</und><x-gs eid="very_xgs_12" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-563b"><x-g-blk eid="very_xg_32"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><x eid="very_x_32" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5639" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="6">She was absolutely furious.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>å¥¹æ„¤æ€’æäº†ã€‚</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="very_xg_33"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><x eid="very_x_33" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5637" e_inline="y" tranID="28" status="6">I'm completely exhausted.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>æˆ‘å®Œå…¨ç­‹ç–²åŠ›å°½äº†ã€‚</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="very_xg_34"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><x eid="very_x_34" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5635" e_inline="y" tranID="30" status="6">You played really brilliantly.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ä½ çš„è¡¨ç°çœŸæ˜¯æ£’æäº†ã€‚</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="very_li_5" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5634" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Very</eb>  is not used with verbs. Use  <eb>very much</eb>  instead.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>åŠ¨è¯ä¸ç”¨ veryï¼Œè€Œç”¨ very much</chn>ï¼š</und><x-gs eid="very_xgs_13" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-5631"><x-g-blk eid="very_xg_35"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><x eid="very_x_35" e_id="13cbac60ff3.-562f" e_inline="y" tranID="32" status="6">We enjoyed staying with you very much.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>æˆ‘ä»¬éå¸¸å–œæ¬¢å¾…åœ¨ä½ è¿™é‡Œã€‚</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:exactly">exactly</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:same">same</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ç”¨ vivid è¿˜æ˜¯ vibrantï¼Ÿ</chn></h3><ul eid="bright_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f6"><li eid="bright_li_8" e_id="13cbabb1a08.-32f5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These two words are very similar, but  <eb>vivid</eb>  emphasizes how bright a colour is, while  <eb>vibrant</eb>  suggests a more lively and exciting colour or combination of colours.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>è¿™ä¸¤ä¸ªè¯éå¸¸ç›¸ä¼¼ï¼Œä½† vivid å¼ºè°ƒé¢œè‰²é²œè‰³æ˜äº®ï¼Œè€Œ vibrant åˆ™æŒ‡è‰²å½©æˆ–é¢œè‰²ç»„åˆæ´»æ³¼è€Œå¯Œç”Ÿæ°”ã€‚</chn></und></li></ul><h3 eid="bright_h3_2" status="6">regard or consider?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ç”¨ regard è¿˜æ˜¯ considerï¼Ÿ</chn></h3><p eid="regard_p_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These two words have the same meaning, but they are used in different patterns and structures. In this meaning  <eb>consider</eb>  must be used with a complement or clause: you can <ei eid="regard_ei_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b3">consider sb/sth to be sth</ei> or <ei eid="regard_ei_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b4">consider sb/sth as sth</ei>, although very often the <ei eid="regard_ei_3" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b5">to be</ei> or <ei eid="regard_ei_4" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b6">as</ei> is left out.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ä¸Šè¿°ä¸¤è¯æ„ä¹‰ç›¸åŒï¼Œä½†ç”¨äºä¸åŒçš„å¥å‹å’Œç»“æ„ã€‚ç”¨äºæ­¤ä¹‰æ—¶ï¼Œconsider å¿…é¡»ä¸è¡¥è¯­æˆ–ä»å¥è¿ç”¨ï¼Œå¯è¯´ consider sb/sth to be sth æˆ– consider sb/sth as sthï¼Œä¸è¿‡ to be æˆ– as å¸¸å¸¸çœç•¥ä¸ç”¨</chn>ï¼š</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_8" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b7"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_12"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_12" e_id="13cbac3027d.35b9" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">He considers himself an expert.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ä»–è®¤ä¸ºè‡ªå·±æ˜¯ä¸“å®¶ã€‚</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_13"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><x eid="regard_x_13" e_id="13cbac3027d.35bb" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">They are considered a high-risk group.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ä»–ä»¬è¢«è§†ä¸ºé«˜å±äººç¾¤ã€‚</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> You can also <ei eid="regard_ei_5" e_id="13cbac3027d.35bc">consider that sb/sth is sth</ei> and again, the <ei eid="regard_ei_6" e_id="13cbac3027d.35bd">that</ei> can be left out.  <eb> Regard</eb>  is used in a narrower range of structures. The most frequent structure is <ei eid="regard_ei_7" e_id="13cbac3027d.35bf">regard sb/sth as sth</ei>; the <ei eid="regard_ei_8" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c0">as</ei> cannot be left out.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ç”¨ consider that sb/sth is sth äº¦å¯ï¼Œthat åŒæ ·å¯ä»¥çœç•¥ã€‚regard å¯ç”¨çš„å¥å‹ç»“æ„è¾ƒå°‘ï¼Œæœ€å¸¸ç”¨çš„ç»“æ„æ˜¯ regard sb/sth as sthï¼Œä½† as ä¸å¯çœç•¥</chn>ï¼š</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_9" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c1"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_14"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><wx eid="regard_wx_1" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c3">I regard him a close friend.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> You cannot <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ä¸èƒ½è¯´</chn>ï¼š</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_10" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c4"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_15"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><wx eid="regard_wx_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c6">regard sb/sth to be sth</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> or <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>æˆ–</chn>ï¼š</und><x-gs eid="regard_xgs_11" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c7"><x-g-blk eid="regard_xg_16"><xsymb>â—†</xsymb><wx eid="regard_wx_3" e_id="13cbac3027d.35c9">regard that sb/sth is sth</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">However,  <eb>regard</eb>  (but not  <eb>consider</eb>  in this meaning) can also be used without a noun or adjective complement but with just an object and adverb <ei eid="regard_ei_9" e_id="13cbac3027d.35cc">(sb/sth is highly regarded)</ei> or adverbial phrase (<ei eid="regard_ei_10" e_id="13cbac3027d.35cd">regard sb/sth with suspicion/jealousy/admiration)</ei>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ä¸è¿‡ï¼Œregard äº¦å¯ä¸ä¸åè¯æˆ–å½¢å®¹è¯è¡¥è¯­è¿ç”¨ï¼Œåªä¸å®¾è¯­å’Œå‰¯è¯ï¼ˆå¦‚ sb/sth is highly regardedï¼‰æˆ–å‰¯è¯çŸ­è¯­ï¼ˆå¦‚ regard sb/sth with suspicion/jealousy/admirationï¼‰è¿ç”¨ï¼›consider åˆ™ä¸èƒ½è¿™æ ·ç”¨ã€‚</chn></und></p><ul eid="regard_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac3027d.35ce"><li eid="regard_li_10" e_id="13cbac3027d.35cf" e_inline="y"><unsyn>see</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to e_id="13cbac3027d.35d9"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"> <eb>View</eb>  has the same meaning as  <eb>regard</eb>  and  <eb>consider</eb>  but is slightly less frequent and slightly less formal. The main structures are <ei eid="regard_ei_11" e_id="13cbac3027d.35dd">view sb/sth as sb/sth</ei> (you cannot leave out the <ei eid="regard_ei_12" e_id="13cbac3027d.35de">as</ei>) and <ei eid="regard_ei_13" e_id="13cbac3027d.35df">view sb/sth with sth</ei>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>view ä¸ regardã€consider æ„ä¹‰ç›¸åŒï¼Œä½†ç•¥ä¸ºä¸å¸¸ç”¨ï¼Œä¹Ÿç•¥éæ­£å¼ã€‚ä¸»è¦ç»“æ„æœ‰ view sb/sth as sb/sthï¼ˆas ä¸èƒ½çœç•¥ï¼‰å’Œ view sb/sth with sthã€‚</chn></und></un></li></ul><h3 eid="regard_h3_2" e_id="13cbac3027d.35e0" e_inline="y" tranID="39" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="regard_ul_4" <eb>generally/usually</eb>  regarded/considered/seen/viewed as sth</und></li><li eid="regard_li_16" e_id="13cbac3027d.35ea" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to regard/consider/view sb/sth virtuous

<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="visible_hg_1"><top-g> <hkey><xhtml:a href="help:keyword"><symbol type="key">ğŸ”‘</symbol></xhtml:a></hkey> <h e_id="13cbac60ff3.-3df3">visÂ·ible</h><hawl> <xhtml:a href="help:awl"><boxtag type="awl">AW</boxtag></xhtml:a> </chnsep><chn>è­¦å¯Ÿåœ¨æˆ‘ä»¬çš„ç¤¾ä¼šä¸­èµ·ç€æå…¶é‡è¦çš„ä½œç”¨ã€‚</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="essential_h3_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f83" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">essential or vital?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ç”¨ essential è¿˜æ˜¯ vitalï¼Ÿ</chn></h3><p eid="essential_p_2" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f82" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words have the same meaning but there can be a slight difference in tone.  <eb>Essential</eb>  is used to state a fact or opinion with authority.  <eb>Vital</eb>  is often used when there is some anxiety felt about sth, or a need to persuade sb that a fact or opinion is true, right or important.  <eb>Vital</eb>  is less often used in negative statements.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ä»¥ä¸Šä¸¤è¯æ„ä¹‰ç›¸åŒï¼Œä½†è¯­æ°”ç¨æœ‰åŒºåˆ«ã€‚essential critical?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ç”¨ crucial è¿˜æ˜¯ criticalï¼Ÿ</chn></h3><p eid="essential_p_3" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-1f6d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words have the same meaning but there can emotions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>ä»¥ä¸Šä¸¤è¯æ„ä¹‰ç›¸åŒï¼Œä½†ä½¿ç”¨åœºåˆç¨æœ‰åŒºåˆ«ã€‚critical å¸¸ç”¨äºå•†ä¸šæˆ–ç§‘å­¦çš„æŠ€æœ¯é—®é¢˜ï¼Œcrucial </chnsep><chn>å¼ºè°ƒé‡ç‚¹</chn></h2><ul eid="emphasis_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6ca2"><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="emphasis_xgs_3" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6ca0"><x-g-blk vitamin C

vocal cords

</>

</>

voluntarily

</>
volunteer

voluptuary

</>

voting
